text: A careless leader is as effective for a nation's hopes as a broken sword is for the survivability of a soldier.
Nostalgia for the ways of the past can hinder a commander's ambition, much like sentiment for a well worn weapon.
Cunningness and forthrightness are the fuel of a leader, akin to a whetstone to a blade.
Just as the edge cares not of the fate of those it pierces, a chieftain must dismiss the babblings of the weak and trust his own path.
The conqueror strikes true with a honed blade, and with a single swing, lays waste to all who defy his design and purpose.
[[b]]Keenness[[/b]] can be gained by winning battle and larger cities.
[[b]]Keenness[[/b]] can be loss by losing battles and general decay.
A conqueror's ambition must have an edge of steel.
• Influences public order negatively while increasing character salary.
• Increases when winning battles and large city sizes.
• Decreases when losing battles, small city sizes, and decay.
A conqueror's ambition must have an edge of steel.
A conqueror's ambition must have an edge of steel.
